types.name: Output
types.description: Destination that `Restream` should restream a live RTMP stream to.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique ID of this `Output`.

fields.name: dst
fields.description: URL to push a live RTMP stream to.

fields.name: label
fields.description: Optional label of this `Output`.

fields.name: volume
fields.description:
Volume rate of this `Output`'s audio tracks when mixed with
`Output.mixins`.

Has no effect when there is no `Output.mixins`.

fields.name: mixins
fields.description:
`Mixin`s to mix this `Output` with before restream to the destination.

If empty, then no mixing is performed and restreaming is as cheap as
possible (just copying bytes "as is").

fields.name: enabled
fields.description:
Indicator whether this `Output` is enabled, so performs a live RTMP
stream restream to destination.

fields.name: status
fields.description:
`Status` of this `Output` indicating whether it pushes media traffic to
destination.

types.name: PullInput
types.description: `Input` pulling a live RTMP stream from a remote server.

fields.name: src
fields.description: URL of a live RTMP stream to be pulled.

fields.name: status
fields.description: `Status` of this `PullInput` indicating whether it performs pulling.

types.name: Mixin
types.description:
Additional source for an `Output` to be mixed with before restreamed to the
destination.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique ID of this `Mixin`.

fields.name: src
fields.description: URL of the source to be mixed in.

fields.name: volume
fields.description: Volume rate of this `Mixin`'s audio tracks to mix them with.

fields.name: delay
fields.description:
Delay that this `Mixin` should wait before mixed with an `Output`.

Very useful to fix de-synchronization issues and correct timings between
`Mixin` and its `Output`.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description:
GraphQL type kind

The GraphQL specification defines a number of type kinds - the meta type of a type.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description:
## Scalar types

Scalar types appear as the leaf nodes of GraphQL queries. Strings, numbers, and booleans are the built in types, and while it's possible to define your own, it's relatively uncommon.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description:
## Object types

The most common type to be implemented by users. Objects have fields and can implement interfaces.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description:
## Interface types

Interface types are used to represent overlapping fields between multiple types, and can be queried for their concrete type.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description:
## Union types

Unions are similar to interfaces but can not contain any fields on their own.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description:
## Enum types

Like scalars, enum types appear as the leaf nodes of GraphQL queries.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description:
## Input objects

Represents complex values provided in queries _into_ the system.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description:
## List types

Represent lists of other types. This library provides implementations for vectors and slices, but other Rust types can be extended to serve as GraphQL lists.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description:
## Non-null types

In GraphQL, nullable types are the default. By putting a `!` after a type, it becomes non-nullable.

types.name: Input
types.description: Source of a live RTMP stream for `Restream`.

types.name: Info
types.description: Information about parameters that server operates with.

fields.name: publicHost
fields.description:
Host that this server is reachable via in public.

Use it for constructing URLs to this server.

fields.name: passwordHash
fields.description:
[Argon2] hash of the password that this server's GraphQL API is
protected with, if any.

Non-`null` value means that any request to GraphQL API should perform
[HTTP Basic auth][1]. Any username is allowed, but the password should
match this hash.

[Argon2]: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argon2
[1]: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Basic_access_authentication

fields.name: info
fields.description: Subscribes to updates of `Info` parameters of this server.

fields.name: restreams
fields.description: Subscribes to updates of all `Restream`s happening on this server.

types.name: Status
types.description: Status indicating what's going on in `Input` or `Output`.

enumValues.name: OFFLINE
enumValues.description: Inactive, no operations are performed and no media traffic is allowed.

enumValues.name: INITIALIZING
enumValues.description: Initializing, media traffic is allowed, but not yet flows as expected.

enumValues.name: ONLINE
enumValues.description:
Active, all operations are performing successfully and media traffic
flows as expected.

types.name: PushInput
types.description: `Input` receiving a live RTMP stream from a remote client.

fields.name: name
fields.description:
Name of a live RTMP stream to expose it with for receiving and
restreaming media traffic.

fields.name: status
fields.description:
`Status` of this `PushInput` indicating whether it receives media
traffic.

fields.name: info
fields.description: Returns current `Info` parameters of this server.

fields.name: restreams
fields.description: Returns all `Restream`s happening on this server.

fields.name: addPullInput
fields.description:
Adds new `Restream` with `PullInput`.

If `id` is specified, then tries to update parameters of the existent
`Restream`.

### Idempotency

Idempotent if `id` is specified. Otherwise is non-idempotent, always
creates a new `Restream` and errors on the `src` duplicates.

### Result

Returns `null` if `Restream` with the given `id` doesn't exist.
Otherwise always returns `true`.

args.name: src
args.description: RTMP URL to pull media stream from.

args.name: id
args.description: ID of `Restream` to be updated rather than creating a new one.

fields.name: addPushInput
fields.description:
Adds new `Restream` with `PushInput`.

If `id` is specified, then tries to update parameters of the existent
`Restream`.

### Idempotency

Idempotent if `id` is specified. Otherwise is non-idempotent, always
creates a new `Restream` and errors on the `name` duplicates.

### Result

Returns `null` if `Restream` with the given `id` doesn't exist.
Otherwise always returns `true`.

args.name: name
args.description: Name of RTMP media stream used in its URL.

args.name: id
args.description: ID of `Restream` to be updated rather than creating a new one.

fields.name: removeInput
fields.description:
Removes `Restream` by its `id`.

### Result

Returns `true` if `Restream` with the given `id` has been removed, or
`false` if it doesn't exist.

fields.name: enableInput
fields.description:
Enables `Restream` by its `id`.

Enabled `Restream` starts accepting or pulling media traffic.

### Result

Returns `true` if `Restream` with the given `id` has been enabled,
`false` if it has been enabled already, and `null` if it doesn't exist.

fields.name: disableInput
fields.description:
Disables `Restream` by its `id`.

Disabled `Restream` stops and forbids accepting or pulling media
traffic.

### Result

Returns `true` if `Restream` with the given `id` has been disabled,
`false` if it has been disabled already, and `null` if it doesn't exist.

fields.name: addOutput
fields.description:
Adds new `Output` to the specified `Restream`.

### Non-idempotent

Always creates a new `Output` and errors on the `dst` duplicates within
the specified `Restream`.

### Result

Returns `null` if `Restream` with the given `inputId` doesn't exist.
Otherwise always returns `true`.

args.name: dst
args.description: RTMP URL to push media stream to.

args.name: mix
args.description: Optional TeamSpeak URL to mix into this `Output`.

fields.name: removeOutput
fields.description:
Removes `Output` by its ID from the specified `Restream`.

### Result

Returns `true` if `Output` with the given `id` has been removed,
`false` if it has been removed already, and `null` if the specified
`Restream` doesn't exist.

fields.name: enableOutput
fields.description:
Enables `Output` by its ID in the specified `Restream`.

Enabled `Output` starts pushing media traffic to its destination.

### Result

Returns `true` if `Output` with the given `id` has been enabled,
`false` if it has been enabled already, and `null` if the specified
`Restream`/`Output` doesn't exist.

fields.name: disableOutput
fields.description:
Disables `Output` by its ID in the specified `Restream`.

Disabled `Output` stops pushing media traffic to its destination.

### Result

Returns `true` if `Output` with the given `id` has been disabled,
`false` if it has been disabled already, and `null` if the specified
`Restream`/`Output` doesn't exist.

fields.name: enableAllOutputs
fields.description:
Enables all `Output`s in the specified `Restream`.

Enabled `Output`s start pushing media traffic to their destinations.

### Result

Returns `true` if at least `Output`has been enabled, `false` if all
`Output`s have been enabled already, and `null` if the specified
`Restream` doesn't exist.

args.name: inputId
args.description: ID of `Restream` to enable all `Output`s in.

fields.name: disableAllOutputs
fields.description:
Disables all `Output`s in the specified `Restream`.

Disabled `Output`s stop pushing media traffic to their destinations.

### Result

Returns `true` if at least `Output` has been disabled, `false` if all
`Output`s have been disabled already, and `null` if the specified
`Restream` doesn't exist.

args.name: inputId
args.description: ID of `Restream` to disable all `Output`s in.

fields.name: tuneVolume
fields.description:
Tunes a `Volume` rate of the specified `Output` or one of its `Mixin`s.

### Result

Returns `true` if a `Volume` rate has been changed, `false` if it has
the same value already, and `null` if the specified `Output` or `Mixin`
doesn't exist.

fields.name: tuneDelay
fields.description:
Tunes a `Delay` before being mixed in of the specified `Mixin` in the
specified `Output`.

### Result

Returns `true` if a `Delay` has been changed, `false` if it has the same
value already, and `null` if the specified `Output` or `Mixin` doesn't
exist.

fields.name: setPassword
fields.description:
Sets or unsets the password to protect this GraphQL API with.

Once password is set, any subsequent requests to this GraphQL API should
perform [HTTP Basic auth][1], where any username is allowed, but the
password should match the one being set.

### Result

Returns if password has been changed or unset, otherwise `false` if
nothing changes.

[1]: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Basic_access_authentication

args.name: new
args.description: New password to be set. In `null` then unsets the current password.

args.name: old
args.description: Old password for authorization, if it was set previously.

types.name: Restream
types.description: Restream of a live RTMP stream from one `Input` to many `Output`s.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique ID of this `Restream`.

fields.name: label
fields.description: Optional label of this `Restream`.

fields.name: input
fields.description: `Input` that live RTMP stream is received from.

fields.name: outputs
fields.description: `Output`s that live RTMP stream is restreamed to.

fields.name: enabled
fields.description:
Indicator whether this `Restream` is enabled, so allows to receive a
live RTMP stream from `Input`.
